summary: The Federally Integrated Species Health Act of 2025 (FISH Act) amends the Endangered Species Act of 1973 to transfer functions related to anadromous (fish spawning in fresh/estuarine water, migrating to ocean) and catadromous (fish spawning in ocean, migrating to fresh/estuarine) species from the Secretary of Commerce/National Marine Fisheries Service to the Secretary of the Interior. The bill defines these species, allows for reconsideration of prior administrative determinations, and includes provisions addressing reference changes, exercise of authorities, and savings clauses for legal documents, proceedings, and suits. It also addresses related definitions.
